headline: Boeing's $10.6B deal, Verizon & 3M earnings: Trending tickers
summary: Here are some of the stocks on the move on Tuesday, April 22. Boeing (BA) is selling portions of its Digital Aviation Solutions business to Thoma Bravo for $10.55 billion. Verizon (VZ) reported better-than-expected first quarter earnings, but its postpaid phone losses rose. 3M (MMM) shares are rising after posting first quarter results that topped Wall Street estimates, though it did warn about the impact of tariffs. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.

headline: Tesla pre-earnings pop, Verizon subscribers, GE Aerospace tariff
summary: On today's Market Minute, Madison Mills outlines the trending stories on Wall Street. Tesla (TSLA) stock is trading higher ahead of its first quarter earnings release. Verizon (VZ) stock is in focus after the company reported quarterly results that showed the telecommunications giant lost more wireless subscribers than expected. GE Aerospace (GE) maintained its full-year earnings guidance, with the company saying it is working to offset tariff impacts. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Don’t Ask Us to Pick Up the Smartphone Tariff Tab, Verizon Warns
summary: Verizon’s chief executive said his company won’t absorb the cost of tariffs on smartphones.  The cellphone carrier warned that its full-year financial guidance, which it affirmed Tuesday, doesn't reflect effects of an "evolving tariff environment" that is hard to predict.  Verizon's stock rose modestly Tuesday morning, underperforming a broader market rally.

Verizon's stock rose modestly Tuesday morning, underperforming a broader market rally.

headline: Verizon posts higher subscriber loss on price hikes, competition
summary: (Reuters) -Verizon Communications lost more wireless subscribers in the first quarter than Wall Street expected, as the U.S. telecom giant grappled with the fallout of recent price hikes and aggressive promotions from rivals.  Shares of the company fell 3.4% in premarket trading.  It also raised monthly prices for its customizable myPlan accounts with five lines or more by $3 per line, while customers on the New Verizon Plan faced a $4 per line increase for single mobile lines.

raw.headline: Verizon posts higher subscriber loss on price hikes, competition
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Verizon Communications lost more wireless subscribers in the first quarter than Wall Street expected, as the U.S. telecom giant grappled with the fallout of recent price hikes and aggressive promotions from rivals.  Shares of the company fell 3.4% in premarket trading.  It also raised monthly prices for its customizable myPlan accounts with five lines or more by $3 per line, while customers on the New Verizon Plan faced a $4 per line increase for single mobile lines.
